bibl.title: Albert B. Martin v. United States. Hearing.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: In the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington.
In the matter of application of Arthur B. Martin for a Writ of Habeas Corpus } Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable the United States District Court of the Western District of Washington,

Your petitioner Arthur B. Martin respectfully shows that he is illegaly confined, detained and restrained of his liberty at the United States Immigration Detention House, at Seattle Wash. by the United Sates Immigration Commissioner that the cause of his confinement, detention and restraint is as follows to the best of your petitioner's information and belief. That your petitioner was arrested June 23, 1910 for the Violation of the Mann Act; and was tried and convicted and sentenced to McNeils Island Prison for the Better of 5 years, that he has fully completed his sentence and was on he say of September 10th 1914 discharged from said prison, that after his discharge he was taken in Custody by an Immigration Inspector and placed in the Immigration Detention House at Seattle, Wash. where he has since been confined that your petitioner is a native of the United Sates, a subject of the Parish of Orleans, state of Louisiana, that your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus be
directed to the United States Immigration Commissioner Henry M. White requiring to produce the body of your petitioner before your Honor to then and there show cause of his detention and why your Petitioner should not be granted his liberty.
State of Washington County of King } ss.

Arthur B. Martin being duly sworn deposes and says that he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition, that the facts set forth and therein are true excepting to there stated on information and belief and to those he believes them to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this the 19th day of September 1914.
div1.ab: John H. Sargent. Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle

figure.ab: John H. Sargent Washington Commission Expires JUN 23 1915 Notary Public
